The 'Pittsburgh Penguins' are a professional ice hockey team based in
Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. They are members of the Metropolitan Division of the
Eastern Conference of the National Hockey League (NHL). The franchise was
founded in 1967 as one of the first expansion teams during the league's original
expansion from six to twelve teams. The Penguins played in the Civic Arena, also
known to Pittsburgh fans as "The Igloo", from the time of their inception
through the end of the 2009â10 season. They moved into their new arena, Consol
Energy Center, to begin the 2010â11 NHL season. They have qualified for four
Stanley Cup Finals, winning the Stanley Cup three times in their history â in
1991, 1992, and 2009.
